  "title": "Creative Lead",
  "description": "TheHRHive -&nbsp;Our client is a Premier African Design &amp; Lifestyle Group and a dynamic multi-brand ecosystem at the forefront of African creativity and commerce. Their portfolio spans several interconnected industries&mdash;from design and retail to hospitality and community building&mdash;creating a unique and synergistic environment.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a dynamic Creative Lead to shape, direct, and execute our visual and creative communication across all platforms. This role requires someone highly versatile, detail-oriented, and deeply connected to art, culture, and digital trends.


Key Responsibilities
Social Media &amp; Digital Storytelling:


	Develop and execute social media strategy across all brand platforms.
	Ensure alignment with brand identity, voice, and values.


Product Photography &amp; Content Creation:


	Oversee creative direction for lifestyle and campaign shoots.


Gallery &amp; Space Curation:


	Curate exhibitions, retail spaces, and hospitality/gallery experiences within S.EA. Experience.
	Collaborate with artists, designers, and partners for seasonal curation.


Graphic Design &amp; Brand Assets:


	Create compelling graphics, marketing materials, and visual assets.
	Ensure brand consistency across online and offline touchpoints.


Videography &amp; Content Direction:


	Lead video shoots for campaigns, documentaries, and social storytelling.
	Manage editing process and creative direction.


Proposals &amp; Presentations:


	Design visually engaging proposals, pitch decks, and client-facing presentations.


Location Scouting &amp; Production:


	Identify and secure suitable locations for shoots, activations, and collaborations.


Travel &amp; Documentation:


	Document experiences, projects, and journeys across all S.EA. brands.
	Translate experiences into content for digital and offline platforms.


E-commerce &amp; Online Sales Monitoring:


	Manage product uploads and ensure accurate descriptions &amp; visuals.
	Monitor online performance and suggest improvements.


Website Management


	Oversee creative uploads, graphics, and content updates across websites.
	Collaborate with developers to ensure design integrity.


Skills &amp; Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree.
	Strong creative portfolio showcasing photography, videography, design, and digital content.
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, InDesign).
	Social media savvy with proven experience in content growth and engagement.
	Experience in e-commerce product uploads and digital sales monitoring.
	Strong eye for design, art, and cultural storytelling.
	Ability to juggle multiple brands and projects simultaneously.
	Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and resourceful.


Engagement Model:


	Full-time (hybrid mode) &ndash; physical operation from our flagship office in Lekki four times a week, with flexibility for special events.
	Will work closely with brand leads and report directly to Group Directors.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resumes and Portfolios to:&nbsp;thehrhive@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Creative Lead Job at HR Hive




        
    

        
        TheHRHive - Our client is a Premier African Design & Lifestyle Group and a dynamic multi-brand ecosystem at the forefront of African creativity and commerce. Their portfolio spans several interconnected industries—from design and retail to hospitality and community building—creating a unique and synergistic environment.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Lead

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dynamic Creative Lead to shape, direct, and execute our visual and creative communication across all platforms. This role requires someone highly versatile, detail-oriented, and deeply connected to art, culture, and digital trends.


Key Responsibilities
Social Media & Digital Storytelling:


	Develop and execute social media strategy across all brand platforms.
	Ensure alignment with brand identity, voice, and values.


Product Photography & Content Creation:


	Oversee creative direction for lifestyle and campaign shoots.


Gallery & Space Curation:


	Curate exhibitions, retail spaces, and hospitality/gallery experiences within S.EA. Experience.
	Collaborate with artists, designers, and partners for seasonal curation.


Graphic Design & Brand Assets:


	Create compelling graphics, marketing materials, and visual assets.
	Ensure brand consistency across online and offline touchpoints.


Videography & Content Direction:


	Lead video shoots for campaigns, documentaries, and social storytelling.
	Manage editing process and creative direction.


Proposals & Presentations:


	Design visually engaging proposals, pitch decks, and client-facing presentations.


Location Scouting & Production:


	Identify and secure suitable locations for shoots, activations, and collaborations.


Travel & Documentation:


	Document experiences, projects, and journeys across all S.EA. brands.
	Translate experiences into content for digital and offline platforms.


E-commerce & Online Sales Monitoring:


	Manage product uploads and ensure accurate descriptions & visuals.
	Monitor online performance and suggest improvements.


Website Management


	Oversee creative uploads, graphics, and content updates across websites.
	Collaborate with developers to ensure design integrity.


Skills & Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree.
	Strong creative portfolio showcasing photography, videography, design, and digital content.
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, InDesign).
	Social media savvy with proven experience in content growth and engagement.
	Experience in e-commerce product uploads and digital sales monitoring.
	Strong eye for design, art, and cultural storytelling.
	Ability to juggle multiple brands and projects simultaneously.
	Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and resourceful.


Engagement Model:


	Full-time (hybrid mode) – physical operation from our flagship office in Lekki four times a week, with flexibility for special events.
	Will work closely with brand leads and report directly to Group Directors.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resumes and Portfolios to: thehrhive@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Branch Manager - Retail Job at Smart Partners Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Smart Partners Consulting Limited (SPCL) is an indigenous consulting firm poised on the business model of collaboration to provide professional services of Human Resources and Business Strategy to different companies in various sectors of Nigeria’s economy. It was incorporated in July 2013. Our idea of collaboration and partnership involves the synergy of tested experts in the market place to research, identify and proffer solutions to the ever dynamic needs of our Clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Branch Manager - Retail

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you a passionate retail professional with strong leadership and sales management skills?
	Join our team as a Branch Manager and take charge of driving growth, customer satisfaction, and operational excellence in our retail branch.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee day-to-day retail operations and ensure excellent customer experience
	Drive sales performance, profitability, and business targets
	Lead, train, and motivate the store team to achieve results
	Manage stock levels, visual merchandising, and store standards
	Ensure compliance with company policies and operational procedures.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Management, or related field
	Minimum of 7–10 years of experience in retail management or branch operations
	Strong leadership, communication, and customer service skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed CV to: talent@smartpartnersng.com using “Branch Manager (Retail)” as the subject of the email.
